news_header: Millions in England and Wales may struggle with rising water bills, which could increase by 21% from 2025 to 2030, according to a consumer watchdog.
news_text: A consumer watchdog warns that millions of households in England and Wales will face difficulties paying their water bills, which are expected to rise by an average of £19 per year (21%) from 2025 to 2030. A survey revealed that 18% of households already struggle with bills, and 40% anticipate difficulty with the upcoming increases. Water companies are proposing increased support for vulnerable customers. Ofwat is in negotiations regarding the bill increases, with some companies seeking even higher hikes. The CCW calls for a unified social tariff to assist low-income households, while Ofwat emphasizes the need for companies to demonstrate effective use of customer funds for infrastructure improvements.
